verses.text: 基督照聖經所記的復活了弟兄們，我要把我從前傳給你們的福音向你們講明。這福音你們已經領受了，並且靠著它站立得穩。

words.note: Lit. 'holy scripture'
Used before verbs to indicate that the verb's action is performed or possessed by the subject.
A common term for fellow believers in Christian contexts.
Lit. 'blessed news'
Indicates the result or degree of an action.

verses.text: 你們若持守我所傳給你們的道，就必靠這福音得救，不然就是徒然相信了。

words.note: Implies a steadfast adherence.
Used before verbs to indicate that the verb's action is performed or possessed by the subject.
Often refers to 'the Word' or 'the Way' in a biblical context.

verses.text: 我從前領受了又傳交給你們那最要緊的，就是基督照著聖經所記的，為我們的罪死了，
又埋葬了，又照著聖經所記的，第三天復活了；
並且曾經向磯法顯現，然後向十二使徒顯現。

words.note: Often used for divine or miraculous appearances.
Lit. 'sent disciple/follower'

verses.text: 以後又有一次向五百多個弟兄顯現。他們中間大多數到現今還在，也有些已經睡了。

words.note: Refers to fellow believers in a spiritual sense.

words.definition: to be alive, to be present

words.note: A euphemism for death in this biblical context.

verses.text: 以後也向雅各顯現，再後又向眾使徒顯現，

words.note: Refers to James, the brother of Jesus, in 1 Corinthians 15.
Often used in biblical context for 'all the...'

verses.text: 最後也向我顯現；我好像一個未到產期而生的人。
我原是使徒中最小的，本來沒有資格稱為使徒，因為我曾經迫害 神的教會。
然而靠著 神的恩典，我得以有了今天，而且他賜給我的恩典並沒有落空；我比眾使徒格外勞苦，其實不是我，而是 神的恩典與我同在。

words.definition: to be able to, to succeed in
to come to nothing, to fail

words.note: Often used in biblical context for 'all the...'
Lit. 'outside the standard/pattern'.

words.definition: to be with, to be together

verses.text: 因此，不論是我，或是眾使徒，我們這樣傳，你們也這樣信了。

words.note: 眾 indicates a group or multitude of people.

verses.text: 死人都要復活我們既然傳基督從死人中復活了，你們中間怎麼有人說沒有死人復活呢？

words.note: A key theological term, meaning 'to return to life'.
Often follows a noun to denote 'among' or 'in the midst of'.

verses.text: 倘若沒有死人復活的事，基督也就沒有復活了。
如果基督沒有復活，我們所傳的就是枉然，你們的信也是枉然，

words.note: Forms a noun phrase from a verb, indicating 'that which is done'.
Means 'to no purpose' or 'fruitlessly'.

verses.text: 我們也會被人認為是替 神作假見證的了，因為我們為 神作過見證說，他使基督復活了。如果死人沒有復活， 神也就沒有使基督復活了。

words.note: Spacing is a traditional way to show respect for the name of God.
A specific legal/religious term for bearing false testimony.
Turns the preceding verb phrase into a noun, 'one who does X'.

verses.text: 因為如果死人沒有復活，基督也就沒有復活。

words.note: Transliteration of Greek 'Christos'.

verses.text: 基督若沒有復活，你們的信就是徒然，你們仍在你們的罪裡。

words.note: Transliteration of Greek 'Christos'.
More formal or literary than '如果'.
Can also mean 'to believe' as a verb.
Often used after '在' to indicate location or state.

verses.text: 那麼，在基督裡睡了的人也就滅亡了。

words.note: Transliteration of Greek 'Christos'.
Often used after '在' to indicate location or state.
In a biblical context, often a euphemism for 'died'.
Indicates completion or change of state.

verses.text: 如果我們在基督裡只在今生有盼望，就比所有人更可憐了。

words.note: Transliteration of Greek 'Christos'.
Often used after '在' to indicate location or state.
Indicates completion or change of state.

verses.text: 現在基督已經從死人中復活，成為睡了的人初熟的果子。

words.note: Transliteration of Greek 'Christos'.
Often used after '從...中' to indicate selection from a group.
In a biblical context, often a euphemism for 'died'.
Refers to the first harvest or produce of the season.

verses.text: 死既藉著一人而來，死人復活也藉著一人而來。

words.note: Lit. 'return to life'

verses.text: 在亞當裡眾人都死了，照樣，在基督裡眾人也都要復活；

words.note: Lit. 'return to life'

verses.text: 只是各人要按著自己的次序：初熟的果子是基督，以後，在他來的時候，是那些屬基督的人。

words.note: Refers to the first produce of a harvest.
Forms a nominal phrase like 'the time of his coming'.

verses.text: 再後，末期到了的時候，基督把所有的統治者、掌權者和有能者都毀滅了，就把國度交給父 神。

words.note: Refers to the end times.
Forms a nominal phrase like 'the time when'.

verses.text: 因為基督必要作王，直到 神把所有的仇敵都放在他的腳下。

words.note: A verb-object compound.
Lit. 'foot under'.

verses.text: 最後要毀滅的仇敵就是死，

words.note: Common in biblical and classical texts.

verses.text: 因為經上記著說：「他使萬物都服在他腳下。」既然說萬物都服了他，顯然那使萬物服他的就不包括在內了。

words.note: Refers to written scripture, particularly the Bible.
Figurative for being subject to someone's authority.

verses.text: 等到萬物都服了他，那時子自己也要服那位叫萬物服他的，好使 神在萬有之上。

words.note: Refers to Jesus as the Son of God in a theological context.
The preceding space is a common convention in some Chinese Bibles.
Often used in formal or classical contexts, particularly religious texts.

verses.text: 不然，那些為死人受洗的，是為了甚麼呢？如果死人根本不會復活，那麼為甚麼要為他們受洗呢？
我們又為甚麼時刻冒險呢？
弟兄們，我是天天冒死的，這是我憑著我在我們的主耶穌基督裡，因你們而誇口說的。

words.note: A common address in biblical texts.
Often used after '在' and a noun to indicate location.

verses.text: 我在以弗所和野獸搏鬥，如果照著人的意思來看，那對我有甚麼益處呢？如果死人不會復活，「我們就吃吃喝喝吧，因為我們明天就要死了。」

words.note: Repetition implies casualness or enjoyment, often with a hint of hedonism in this context.

verses.text: 你們不要自欺，「濫交朋友是會敗壞品德的。」
你們理當醒悟過來，不要犯罪，因為你們中間有人不認識 神；我說這話是要你們羞愧。

words.definition: wake up, come to one's senses

words.note: The space before 神 (Shén) indicates reverence in some Bible translations.

verses.text: 復活的身體但有人會說：「死人怎樣復活呢？要帶著怎麼樣的身體來呢？」
無知的人哪，你所種的若不死去，就不能生。

words.note: Nominalizes the following verb phrase.
Verb complement indicating completion or departure.

verses.text: 你們所種的，不是那將來要長成的形體，只不過是一粒種子，也許是麥子或別的種子。

words.note: Nominalizes the following verb phrase.

verses.text: 但 神隨著自己的意思給它一個形體，給每一樣種子各有自己的形體。

words.note: Refers to the singular God, hence capitalized.

verses.text: 而且各種身體也都不一樣，人有人的身體，獸有獸的身體，鳥有鳥的身體，魚有魚的身體。
有天上的形體，也有地上的形體；天上形體的榮光是一樣，地上形體的榮光又是一樣。

words.note: Here implies 'of one kind' or 'the same'.
Here implies 'of one kind' or 'the same'.

verses.text: 太陽有太陽的榮光，月亮有月亮的榮光，星星有星星的榮光，而且每一顆星的榮光也都不同。

words.note: Lit. 'glorious light'.
Lit. 'glorious light'.
Reduplication creates a plural/diminutive sense.
Reduplication creates a plural/diminutive sense.
Lit. 'glorious light'.
Lit. 'glorious light'.

verses.text: 死人復活也是這樣。所種的是必朽壞的，復活的是不朽壞的；

words.note: Refers to those who have died.
Classical particle indicating a passive or nominalized action.

verses.text: 所種的是卑賤的，復活的是榮耀的；所種的是軟弱的，復活的是有能力的；

words.note: Classical particle indicating a passive or nominalized action.
Classical particle indicating a passive or nominalized action.

verses.text: 所種的是屬血氣的身體，復活的是屬靈的身體。既然有屬血氣的身體，也會有屬靈的身體。

words.note: Classical particle indicating a passive or nominalized action.
Describes something governed by human nature, not spirit.
Describes something pertaining to the spirit.
Describes something governed by human nature, not spirit.
Describes something pertaining to the spirit.

verses.text: 經上也是這樣記著說：「第一個人亞當成了有生命的活人，末後的亞當成了使人活的靈。」

words.note: Literally 'on the scripture'.

verses.text: 但那首先的不是屬靈的，而是屬血氣的，然後才有屬靈的。

words.note: Refers to things pertaining to the spirit or Holy Spirit.
Biblically, refers to the unregenerate human nature or flesh.

verses.text: 第一個人是出於地，是屬土的；第二個人是出於天。

words.note: Refers to humans being formed from the dust of the ground (Genesis 2:7).

verses.text: 那屬土的怎樣，所有屬土的也都怎樣；屬天的怎樣，所有屬天的也都怎樣。

words.note: Refers to things pertaining to heaven or God.

verses.text: 我們既然有了屬土的形象，將來也必有屬天的形象。
弟兄們，我告訴你們，血肉之體不能承受 神的國，必朽壞的也不能承受那不朽壞的。

words.note: Common address for fellow believers in the Bible.
Refers to the mortal, natural human body, subject to decay.
Refers to that which is subject to decay or death.
Refers to that which is not subject to decay or death.

verses.text: 我現在把一個奧祕告訴你們：我們不是都要睡覺，而是在一剎那，眨眼之間，就是號角最後一次吹響的時候，我們都要改變；因為號角要吹響，死人要復活，成為不朽壞的，我們也要改變。

words.note: Refers to a divine mystery in scripture.
More literary/formal than 瞬間 (shùnjiān).

words.definition: in a blink of an eye
words.note: A fixed expression meaning 'very quickly'.
In biblical context, refers to a trumpet used for signaling divine events.
Primarily used in religious contexts for resurrection.
Refers to a state of not decaying or perishing.

verses.text: 這必朽壞的必須穿上不朽壞的，這必死的必須穿上不死的；

words.note: Refers to that which is subject to decay or corruption.
Refers to a state of immortality.

verses.text: 這必朽壞的既穿上了不朽壞的，這必死的既穿上了不死的，那時，經上的話就應驗了：「勝利了！死亡已經被吞滅。

words.note: Refers to what is written in the Bible.
Often used for prophecies or divine promises.
Often used in scripture for destructive consumption.

verses.text: 死亡啊！你的勝利在哪裡？死亡啊！你的毒刺在哪裡？」

words.note: Biblical imagery for the harmful effect of death.

verses.text: 死的毒刺就是罪，罪的權勢就是律法。

words.note: In religious contexts, refers to transgression against divine law.
Often refers to God's law or the Mosaic Law.

verses.text: 感謝 神，他藉著我們的主耶穌基督，把勝利賜給我們。

words.note: The preceding space indicates reverence for God.
Refers to God or Christ in a religious context.
賜 implies bestowal from a higher authority.

verses.text: 所以，我親愛的弟兄們，你們務要堅固，不可動搖，常常竭力多作主工，因為知道你們的勞苦，在主裡面不是徒然的。

words.note: Used for fellow believers in Christ.
A formal and emphatic way to express 'must'.
Implies doing one's utmost.
Often implies strenuous effort or hardship.
Refers to God or Christ in a religious context.
More common in classical or religious contexts.
